edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.client
Class SDARTSBean

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.client.SDARTSBean
public class SDARTSBean
extends java.lang.Object

The main client class. SDARTS clients, be they Servlet, JSP, application, or Applet based, instantiate a SDARTSBean in order to talk to one single SDARTS LSP. A client must instantiate multiple SDARTSBeans to talk to multiple LSPs.

The class includes a simplified interface that reflects SDARTS's synchronous nature - all methods return Strings that contain SDLIP/STARTS XML. See individual method signatures for XML descriptions. There are methods for searching, getting the sub-collection information, getting the property list for one "back-end / sub-collection" of an LSP, and the getting the supported interfaces for the LSP - these are all analagous to the methods in sdlip.Search and sdlip.MetaData.

The SDARTSBean uses SDLIP's HTTP/DASL transport layer (see sdlip.helpers.ClientDaslTransport and sdlip.helpers.ClientTransportModule). It does not use the SDLIP CORBA transport layer.

A SDARTSBean is initialized in its constructor with URLs for the SDARTS LSP itself, the location of the STARTS DTD, and the location of the SDLIP DTD. All XML outputted by the bean includes < !DOCTYPE ... > headers pointed at the DTDs, and will pass any validation against these DTDs. The SDLIP namespace is the default namespace; all STARTS elements will have a "starts:" namespace prefix.

There is also a main() method, for use by the testclient.sh script that comes with SDARTS.

Constructor Detail

SDARTSBean

public SDARTSBean(java.lang.String lspURL)
           throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Instantiates a SDARTSBean and immediately connects it to the SDARTS LSP it is meant to communicate with. It looks for the STARTS and SDLIP DTDs in their default locations.
Parameters:
lspURL - the URL of the SDARTS LSP this bean is communicating with

SDARTSBean

public SDARTSBean(java.lang.String lspURL,
                  java.lang.String startsDTDURL,
                  java.lang.String sdlipDTDURL)
           throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Instantiates a SDARTSBean and immediately connects it to the SDARTS LSP it is meant to communicate with
Parameters:
lspURL - the URL of the SDARTS LSP this bean is communicating with
startsDTDURL - the URL for the STARTS DTD, which is mentioned as an external parameter entity in all outputted XML
sdlipDTDURL - the URL for the SDLIP DTD, which is mentioned as the primary < !DOCTYPE > for all outputted XML
Method Detail

search

public java.lang.String search(java.lang.String sdlipSubCollections,
                               java.lang.String startsXMLQuery,
                               org.omg.CORBA.IntHolder expectedTotal,
                               int numDocs)
                        throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Performs a search. Results returned as a combined SDLIP/STARS XML string of the form: 
 <SearchResult>
    <doc>
       <DID> 0...n </DID>
           <propList>
              <starts:sqresults>
                 . . . . . . .
              </starts:sqresults>
           </propList>
    </doc>
    .....
 </SearchResult>

There will be one <doc> element, with associated embedded STARTS XML, for each subcollection/back-end that is queried.

Parameters:
subcols - an SDLIP header that lists the subcollections to be queried. This should be of <subcols> type - see the SDLIP DTD. This overlaps with the "sources" element of the STARTS XML query. The policy is to search the union of sources in this parameter and what is in the STARTS header. Subcollections or sources are another name for Back End LSPs.
query - the actual query. This should be STARTS XML in the form of <starts:squery> .... </starts:squery>. See the STARTS DTD.
numDocs - number of documents to be returned. This overlaps with the max-docs attribute of the STARTS query. The policy is to use the maximum of these two numbers for number of documents returned.
expectedTotal - an OUT parameter. Will contain the sum of all numDocs attributes of the returned STARTS starts:sqresults objects. This cannot be null - a caller of this class must pass in an empty org.omg.CORBA.IntHolder.
Returns:
A combined SDLIP/STARTS XML string of the form: <SearchResult> ... <starts:sqresults> .... </starts:sqresults> </SearchResult>

getInterface

public java.lang.String getInterface()
                              throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Calls the equivalent of the sdlip.Metadata.getInterface() method. See the SDLIP documentation.
Returns:
an SDLIP XML string of doctype < SDLIPInterface >

getPropertyInfo

public java.lang.String getPropertyInfo(java.lang.String subcolName)
                                 throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Calls the equivalent of the sdlip.Metadata.getPropertyInfo() method. The caller specifies which "subcollection" or "SDARTS backend" to search. The method returns an SDLIP XML string of doctype <propList>, with the STARTS header <starts:smeta-attributes> embedded inside. See the SDLIP documentation for description of the SDLIP method, and the STARTS documentation for information about the <starts:smeta-attributes> tag
Parameters:
subcolName - which subcollection (aka back-end) of the SDARTS LSP to get property information about
Returns:
an SDLIP XML string of doctype <propList>, with the STARTS header <starts:smeta-attributes> embedded inside.

getSubcollectionInfo

public java.lang.String getSubcollectionInfo()
                                      throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Calls the equivalent of the sdlip.Metadata.getSubcollectionInfo() method. This returns an SDLIP string containing an SDLIP <subcolInfo> element. Note that the subcollections listed in this response correspond to the names of the SDARTS LSP's back-end LSPs. See the SDLIP documentation for more information about this reply.
Returns:
an SDLIP string containing an SDLIP <subcolInfo> element

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This main() method is used by the testclient.sh script included with the SDARTS distribution. It assumes that the STARTS DTD resides at http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~dli2test/dtd/starts.dtd, and the SDLIP DTD resides at http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~dli2test/dtd/sdlip.dtd. It accepts two arguments, the second of which is optional. The first argument is the name of the LSP to contact. This can be either an unqualified LSP name, or a URL. The second argument is optional - the filename for an XML file containing a <starts:squery>. If given, the method will load this file and attempt to query underlying collections with it.

This method will call the search() and getSubcollectionInfo() methods on the LSP contacted. From the output of the second method, it will then determine what subcollections/back-ends are present, and will call getPropertyInfo() for each one. Again, if a query filename has been specified, the method will then try to execute the query on all sources requested in the query.

Parameters:
args - the arguments to the method.
